Authors:
YUAN S. LIU, Jaturong - Kumla, Nakarin Suwannarach,
Phongeun Sysouphanthong, Saisamorn Lumyong
Title:
First record of Amanita aureofloccosa from Thailand and its
global geographical distribution
Keywords:
1 new record, Amanitaceae, Species diversity,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
A comprehensive morphological and phylogenetic study of a
new Amanita record from Thailand named A. aureofloccosa belonging to A.
section Lepidella is here undertaken. This species is unique among
congeners by having a pulverulent, bright orange-yellow volva remnant on
its pileus, a slender stipe covered by orange-yellow floccose scales, a
globose to subglobose, amyloid basidiospore and the lacking of clamps in
all parts of basidioma. Particular morphological characteristics, along
with the phylogenetic analysis based on a combined dataset of partial
nuclear rDNA internal transcribed spacers region (ITS) and partial
nuclear rDNA large subunit region (nrLSU) confirmed our specimens are A.
aureofloccosa. A brief geographical distributions, a detailed
description, line-drawing illustrations and a brief comparison with
morphological similar taxa are provided.
